title: This Morning's Andrea Williams slammed after same-sex marriage debate
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

A woman who opposes same-sex marriage and abortion was slammed after sharing her opinion on This Morning.

Andrea Williams appeared on the ITV daytime show alongside Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes to debate Northern Ireland’s decision to decriminalise abortion and gay marriage.

‘For the people of Northern Ireland, they’ve not had a chance to say what they believe in,’ Andrea began.

She continued: ‘There will be many people in this country that hold firmly and deeply to the view that marriage is the life-long union of one man and one woman.

‘Many people will go on to recoginise that whether or not that’s in law, that is not something that is true marriage.

‘It’s been recognised in law for centuries being one man and one woman, just because today we say it’s two men and two women you can’t suddenly overhold the whole history of marriage.’

Andrea appeared on today’s This Morning (Picture: ITV)

Melissa Thompson, who argued against Andrea, replied: ‘I think family is made up of all sorts of different people.

‘This whole idea of a man and a woman, some times people raise their children in one-parent families, sometimes you have two mums and a dad, I think as long as there’s love, it doesn’t matter.

‘Ultimately, Andrea, with all due respect, hard-luck because we are moving forward.’

Unsurprisingly, the debate got a lot of reaction on social media and audiences raced to comment on Twitter.

Viewers were rattled by Andrea’s opinion

Can somebody tell this Andrea woman that we arent in the dark ages anymore because she clearly didnt get the memo #ThisMorning — Anna Marie (@annie_m282) October 22, 2019

@thismorning #thismorning My blood is boiling watching Andrea Williams and her backwards, small minded views, get off of my tv and get into the real world. — Lauren Coombes (@LaurenCoombesx) October 22, 2019

#ThisMorning thank god that’s over, love who ever you want, don’t let people like that bring you down, what Northern Ireland did was right, let women have the right to choose abortion, man or woman ? Who cares , as long as there is love, be you. — Ryan (@Ryan_Jonesy) October 22, 2019

This debate about abortion laws and same sex marriage is making me so angry. The woman on the left is an absolute tool. #ThisMorning — Meg 🍁 (@megangoodier) October 22, 2019

In terms of abortion, Andrea told Ruth and Eamonn: ‘There is an argument that has long been held about the most vulnerable people in society from the point of conception to the point of natural death.

‘As I said before here, 100,000 people are alive in Northern Ireland because they believe in the personhood of the unborn child.’

This Morning airs weekdays at 10.30am on ITV.
